snippet: The Supreme Judicial Court ruled on a case of a state lawmaker who sought a criminal charge over a flier accusing him of putting sex offenders ahead of families.
abstract: Massachusetts' Supreme Judicial Court rules that 1946 law barring publication of false statements about political candidates is unconstitutional and inconsistent with free speech; follows complaint from Rep Brian Mannal concerning opposition fliers created by Jobs First PAC.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Judicial Court ruled on a case of a state lawmaker who sought a criminal charge over a flier accusing him of putting sex offenders ahead of families.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Ban on False Political Statements Unconstitutional
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Ban on False Political Statements
